item.title: Report E-2024080439
item.description:
Report E-2024080439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11, 2024, at 0239 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Bessemer, Alabama regarding the release of ZEP Formula 940-E (UN3266, Corrosive Liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., (Sodium Metasilicate), 8, II). Terminal personnel reported that a total of 2 cups were release during transit from 4 crushed 1-gallon plastic bottles due to improper loading and impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release with absorbents, then containerized all waste in (1) 55-gallon DF that was staged onsite pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080420
item.description:
Report E-2024080420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 31, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum, then utilized absorbents hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
